name: Divisibility Problem
description:
You are given two positive integers 
    a
 and 
    b
. In one move you can
increase 
    a
 by 
    1
 (replace 
    a
 with 
    a+1
). Your task is to
find the minimum number of moves you need to do in order to make 
    a

divisible by 
    b
. It is possible, that you have to make 
    0
 moves, as

    a
 is already divisible by 
    b
. You have to answer 
    t

independent test cases. Input The first line of the input contains one integer

    t
 (
    1 
    ≤ t 
    ≤ 10^4
) — the number of test cases. Then 
    t

test cases follow. The only line of the test case contains two integers

    a
 and 
    b
 (
    1 
    ≤ a, b 
    ≤ 10^9
). Output For each test case
print the answer — the minimum number of moves you need to do in order to make

    a
 divisible by 
    b
. Example Input 5 10 4 13 9 100 13 123 456 92 46
Output 2 5 4 333 0
